chapter.title: Running the Example
chapter.para: This chapter container brief instructions how to run example.

section.title: Basic configuration
section.para: Before running example ensure that all SIP addresses configured via SBB environment entries are valid.
In binary release please edit sbb-jar.xml to ensure proper values. Since &THIS.EXAMPLE; Example does not depend on Registrar URI s must be direct address of UA .

step.title: UA Configuration
step.para: Start SIP UA s. Ensure admins UA is bound to previously configured SIP URL .

step.title: Start JSLEE
step.para: Start container, for instance with such command: $ bin/run.sh -b 127.0.0.1 -c default

step.title: Start MMS
step.para:
Start MMS, for instance with such command:
$ bin/run.sh
By defautl in binds to 127.0.0.1 (see server documentation for details)

step.title: Access web interface
step.para: Access following address with browser: http://127.0.0.1:8080/ShoppingDemo

step.title: Create account
step.para: Create account - fill all required data, ensure that Phone points to SIP UA (for instance sip:shop_lifter@127.0.0.1:5060 ).

step.title: Start shopping
step.para: Make orders and checkout, wait for calls.

section.title: &THIS.EXAMPLE; Administrator
section.para: The administration screens take use jBPM to manage the approval and shipping cycle for orders. The business process may even be changed dynamically, by selecting a different process definition! However for Converged Demo we will always use 'ordermanagement3' business process. Steps 1 to 4 would be same as '5.2. Shopping Demo Regular customer'

step.title: Admin Account
step.para: The Admin account is created by system. The user id is 'manager' and password is 'password' to log in as manager

step.title: UI
step.para: Once logged in you should see bellow screen. There are only two tabs 'Manage Orders' and 'Process Status'. As name suggests 'Manage Orders' is to manage the order and 'Process Status' shows the status of Order.
